member.name: M:CSC160_ConsoleMenu.CIO.PromptForMenuSelection(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates a console-based menu using the strings in options as the menu items. Automatically numbers each option starting at 1 and incrementing by 1. Reserves the number 0 for the "quit" option when withQuit is true.
member.returns: the int of the selection made by the user

member.name: M:CSC160_ConsoleMenu.CIO.PromptForBool(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a prompt that expects the user to enter one of two responses that will equate to a boolean value. The trueString represents the case insensitive response that will equate to true. The falseString acts similarly, but for a false boolean value. Example: Assume this method is called with a trueString argument of "yes" and a falseString argument of "no". If the user enters "YES", the method returns true. If the user enters "no", the method returns false. All other inputs are considered invalid, the user will be informed, and the prompt will repeat.
member.param: the prompt to be displayed to the user
the case insensitive value that will evaluate to true
the case insensitive value that will evaluate to false

member.name: M:CSC160_ConsoleMenu.CIO.PromptForByte(System.String,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Generates a prompt that expects a numeric input representing a byte value. This method loops until valid input is given.
member.param: the prompt to be displayed to the user

member.name: M:CSC160_ConsoleMenu.CIO.PromptForInput(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates a prompt that allows the user to enter any response and returns the string. When allowEmpty is true, empty responses are valid. When false, responses must contain at least one character (including whitespace).
member.param: the prompt to be displayed to the user.
when true, makes empty responses valid
member.returns: the input from the user as a String

members.member:
Generates a prompt that expects a single character input representing a char value. This method loops until valid input is given.
the prompt to be displayed to the user the inclusive minimum boundary the inclusive maximum boundary the char value Console.ReadKey().KeyChar
